bbbb.description:
I prefer LCGs over QCGs to be honest...
Based off BBB from SECCON CTF 2022.

chessrs.description: Blazingfast rust wasm chess (the flag is in the admin bot's cookie).

codebox.description: Strellic makes csp challs, maybe i should try one sometime.

dicer-visor.description: Welcome to DiceGang's newest hypervisor-based security solution, Dicer-Visor.

disc-pwn.description:
DISC: Diced Instruction Set Computer.
Now pwn it!
(This is the same binary as rev/disc-rev, you may want to try that first)
Note: remote flag will be the same size as template flag in binary.

geminiblog.description: I wrote my own client and server for the gemini protocol. Come try it out!

gift.description: Send money to all your friends! Can you get enough balance to see /flag?

jnotes.description: I made this note site before I learned about XSS... can you break it? Thankfully my cookies are HttpOnly.

jwtjail.description: A simple tool to verify your JWTs! Oh, that CVE? Don't worry, we're running the latest version.

mlog.description: The future of log lines is here! Get your ML infused log lines and never worry about missing information in your logs. NOTE: this challenge uses a heavy PoW because unfortunately OpenAI is expensive. Please use your own OpenAI API key to test; then once you are confident, try against the remote server. Quickstart: install poetry, then run poetry install and OPENAI_KEY=<your key here> poetry run mlog.

pike.description: Surely this time, my calculator app will be safe! After starting the instance, use socat tcp-listen:1337,fork,reuseaddr openssl:<ip>:<port> to create an SSL proxy to the server - socat >=1.7.4.0 is required.

prison-reform.description: Due to unprecedented levels of contrivedness, I am calling for the CTF community to abolish private pyjails. But first, try this one.

provably-secure-2.description: Now with less cheese! Still pretty simple though.

provably-secure.description: I proved this cryptographic combiner to be super secure (specifically IND-CCA2) on my graduate cryptography final exam, but just to be safe, I'm making you break it with both primitives being computationally secure!

recursive-csp.description:
The nonce isn't random, so how hard could this be?
(The flag is in the admin bot's cookie).

scorescope.description: I'm really struggling in this class. Care to give me a hand?

seaside.description: You've heard of being caught between a rock and a hard place, but what about the land and sea? Try to break this oblivious transfer protocol.

term-zelda.description:
Try out my cool new zelda game!!
socat file:$(tty),raw,echo=0 tcp:url:port

unfinished.description: It's the day of the CTF and I haven't finished writing this challenge... Well, unfinished doesn't mean unsolvable.

vinaigrette.description: Welcome to Dice Bistro, where every bite is an adventure in flavor. Our secret vinaigrette recipe is closely guarded, ensuring that its tantalizing taste remains a mystery to all but the most skilled cryptographers.

log4j.name: log4j
log4j.author: 2dukes
log4j.description: Vulnerable web application to Apache Log4j exploit. Will you be able to get the secret flag?

active-directory.name: active-directory
active-directory.author: 2dukes
active-directory.description: Some extremely vulnerable Active Directory Domain Controller was found out there. Will you be able to get through it?

ransomware.name: ransomware
ransomware.author: 2dukes
ransomware.description: A malicious .exe file encrypted the flag file inside the briefcase folder. Will you be able to crack it? IDA Free version and x64dbg portable are already installed.
